newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinian CPI up 1.13 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: Palestinian CPI up 1.13 pct in July.

text.p: The Palestinian consumer price index (CPI) rose 1.13 percent in July against 0.53 percent in June, the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics (PCBS) said on Thursday.
The PCBS said in a report that the Palestinian CPI has risen 7.27 percent since July 1996.
It said prices rose in most main sectors, led by increases in foodstuffs, tobacco, textiles and clothing.
It said aggregate consumer prices added 1.22 percent in Arab East Jerusalem, 1.49 percent in the Gaza Strip and 0.47 percent in the West Bank.
The PCBS, which began issuing data in November 1995, calculates prices in East Jerusalem, the Gaza Strip and the West Bank separately due to the geographic divisions between them.
The Palestinian Authority controls only parts of the West Bank and Gaza, while Israel controls East Jerusalem.
